column4: how do I configure my system so fsck never runs in interactive mode at boot? it's a headless server 1500 miles away from me.
you can use:  sudo tune2fs -i 0 -c 0 /dev/sda1    (assuming your system partition is sda1) and it won't automatically fsck
thanks, that'll help. but what if the disk didn't unmount cleanly? fsck must run, but it needs to run automatically for me.
